hackathon-description-text: A 24-hour hackathon themed around making positive change in the world with technology.

hackathon-judges.judge-role: Founder of Masters of Engineering Entrepreneurship and Innovation program

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: $500 cash or option to donate to a charity of choice + Dell Venue 10 Tablets
$250 cash or option to donate to a charity of choice + Muse Headband
$150 cash or option to donate to a charity of choice
Provided by MLH - Best Use of Amazon Web Services wins a Dell 1TB External Hard Drive
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: (AWS) Best Use of Amazon Web Services

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Provided by MLH - Best Domain Registered on Domain.com wins a Domain.com Swag Pack with an Arduino RedBoard

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Hardware Hack Presented by Genius
Best Project in Sustainability Presented by GE
Best Project Using Azure Presented by Microsoft

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Bonus prize awarded to a team in the top 6
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: W Booth School of Engineering Practice Prize for Most Innovative or Entrepreneurial Idea

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=1280 Main St W, Hamilton, ON L8S 4E8, Canada

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion:
(Out of 3) How ready is the hack? Is it fully functional and looks good?

**If your hack isn't complete yet, submit anyways! You could still win**
(Out of 5) How difficult was creating the hack? How interesting is the hack created?
(Out of 12) How much change will the hack bring? Is it solving a real world problem?
(Out of 5) How original is the hack?

hackathon-location-address: 1280 Main St W, Hamilton, ON L8S 4E8, Canada
hackathon-description-header: Hack for change and solve real world problems!
hackathon-location-description: McMaster University - McMaster University Student Centre
